How does Verus approach privacy on its blockchain, and what are its goals for enabling private transactions on mobile devices?

Verus is committed to ensuring privacy on its blockchain, dispelling the common misconception that all blockchain transactions are private. In reality, most blockchain transactions, including those on Bitcoin, are publicly visible, including the public addresses involved. To address this, Verus utilizes zk-SNARKs technology to enable provably anonymous transactions, ensuring that votes or transactions remain private unless disclosed by the voter or sender. This technology allows for verifiable transactions while maintaining the privacy of the parties involved.

In terms of mobile devices, Verus aims to support private transactions, known as z-transactions, on mobile phones. Currently, due to the high memory requirements of zk-SNARK transactions, mobile phones are not capable of generating these transactions. However, as zk-SNARK technology advances and becomes more efficient, Verus plans to integrate these improvements into its chain, enabling z-transactions and all Verus features on mobile devices.

In the interim, Verus will focus on providing a mobile wallet for transparent transactions, with the ultimate goal of enabling full privacy features on mobile devices as soon as possible. By doing so, Verus is committed to providing a secure, private, and accessible blockchain experience for its users.
